meanings.definition: The action of gathering or herding animals into a confined area.
meanings.sent1: The yarding of the sheep was done carefully to ensure none escaped.
meanings.sent2: The rancher led the yarding of the cattle into the pen for feeding.
meanings.sent3: The yarding of the chickens into the coop turned into a comical chase.
meanings.sent4: The yarding of the horses symbolized unity and teamwork among the riders.
meanings.sent5: The yarding of the pigs was a noisy and chaotic affair.

meanings.definition: A group of animals gathered or herded into a confined area.
meanings.sent1: The yarding of the cows created a peaceful scene in the barn.
meanings.sent2: The yarding of the ducks by the pond attracted curious onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The yarding of the goats resembled a fluffy, moving carpet.
meanings.sent4: The yarding of the rabbits in the hutch was like a bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The yarding of the geese showcased their synchronized movements.

meanings.definition: The act of enclosing or confining something within a yard or similar space.
meanings.sent1: The yarding of tools in the shed made them easy to find.
meanings.sent2: The yarding of the toys in the play area kept them organized.
meanings.sent3: The yarding of the books on the shelf looked like a colorful display.
meanings.sent4: The yarding of the cars in the parking lot created a neat arrangement.
meanings.sent5: The yarding of the plants in the garden added a touch of greenery.
